Video.Text: Here's a video to help you teach your child problem-solving skills!

Set of messages 1.Message 1: Challenges are stressful. But problem-solving can really help. There are 6 basic steps for problem solving:
Set of messages 1.Message 2:
1. Identify the problem
2. Think of possible solutions
3. Figure out what the results of each solution would be
4. Choose one solution 
5. Try it out!
6. Did it work? Great! If it did not work, then try another solution
Set of messages 1.Interaction message: Would you like to learn more?
Set of messages 1.Message for negative answer: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit. Helping your teen learn how to solve problems will be something they will take with them the rest of their lives. What a gift!

Set of messages 2.Message 1: We can also teach our children the same steps.
Set of messages 2.Message 2:
When something bad happens, we often get upset and blame our children. But what they really need is someone to help them work through their problems. 
Take a Pause! Become aware of anger and stress. Take a deep breath or count to 10 before you react. Then respond in a calmer way.
Set of messages 2.Message 3:
Try to find solutions together:
• Allow your teen to express how they feel and accept their feelings. 
• Try to listen to your teen and see things from their perspective. 
• Thank your teen for being open and trusting you
Set of messages 2.Message 4: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit. Helping your teen learn how to solve problems will be something they will take with them the rest of their lives. What a gift!
